content.raw:
Thanks David, your method \(now included in this PR\) worked an absolute treat.

Basically the remaining issue with this pull request prior to including your method was that restarting a tab in BLACS does _not_ run shutdown code for that tab, even if the tab is not in an error state. Therefore the ‘default baud rate’ was not being restored upon tab restart, and so the initialisation code could not talk to the device. The only way around this previously was to power cycle the device to restore its default baud rate, but with your trick the startup code can now work with the device in either case. It seems to be working excellently.
